intro: Johrenia popovii, commonly known as the Popov's johrenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or yellow flowers bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Johrenia popovii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
